author: potuz
content: My thinking about having the observation window at 10s instead of 12 is that aggregations come typically fast and if we catch enough votes to beat the threshold then we still have 2 seconds to build the block. This of course is based on my admittedly naive idea that we should be engineering thinking on local building

author: arnili
content: with just a small sample size i'm able to check all my builders, decide it's not worth it, build my own block, import it and attest on it in 1200ms

author: arnili
content: there really should be enough time if everyone started their duties in time

author: sproul
content:
you probably have the advantage of having sent a forkchoiceUpdated message to your execution node some seconds prior though

in the case Potuz and I are discussing that gets suppressed until the 10s/11.5s mark

author: sproul
content: (because of a re-org misprediction: we think we will propose on the parent until we process the attestations from the current slot and realise that we must propose on the current block)
